docs.snippet: Countries, religions and corporations sometimes do awful things in their names. It doesn’t diminish them to note their failures; it elevates them....
docs.lead_paragraph: Countries, religions and corporations sometimes do awful things in their names. It doesn’t diminish them to note their failures; it elevates them.
docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column urges Pres Obama, on 150th anniversary of Juneteenth, when last American slaves were told of their freedom, to issue formal apology for United States' history of slavery; holds doing so would capitalize on significance of date to begin to ease long-simmering racial hatred that events have shown to be very much alive in United States; contends other countries and institutions have elevated themselves by issuing apologies for atrocities committed in their names, and apology for slavery could do same.

docs.abstract: News of a mass shooting in Charleston, S.C., has rippled across the campaign trail and prompted candidates to weigh in, the trade fight has helped shift focus from a Democrat-led filibuster in the Senate, and Senator Rand Paul is looking to a social media app to woo young voters.
